title: Machine Gun Kelly vows to get help after pushing crew member
text:
Machine Gun Kelly vows to get help after he wraps up his tour (Picture: WireImage)

Machine Gun Kelly has vowed to ‘get help’ when he wraps up his current tour.

The US rapper, who’s real name is Colson Baker, made the promise on Twitter after footage surfaced online of him appearing to shove a crew member during his Chicago gig on Friday night.

In a video shared by TMZ, Kelly is seen storming off stage and pushing one of the team.

The publication claims Kelly lost his cool when his guitar suffered a technical mishap mid way through his track Hollywood Whore.

He was meant to be performing a guitar solo, but shoves the crew member after realising his guitar isn’t working properly and follows him around instead of carrying on with the track, as it continues to play.

Addressing the incident on Twitter, Kelly, who recently revealed he now wants to collaborate with rival Eminem despite their bitter feud, apologised for his actions.

He wrote: ‘Tonight the frustrations from my personal life came out on the stage. sorry to my fans and my band. i’ll get help after tour is over.’

Metro.co.uk has reached out to MGK’s rep.

Fans were quick to send their support to Kelly, recognising he is going through a hard time and urging him to seek out help sooner, if he feels he needs to.

Kelly had been performing at Credit Union 1 Pavilion in Chicago and is due to wrap up his current tour in Los Angeles at the Hollywood Palladium on 18 November.
